visualization.name: Sequencing ChiRAViz
visualization.description: ChiRA tool for chimeric read data
visualization.help:
# ChiRA Visualization Tool
**ChiRAViz** is a visualization tool for exploring *chimeric read alignments* using datasets produced by the ChiRA tool, typically in `chira.sqlite` format.
This visualization enables researchers to interactively examine structural variations, fusion transcripts, and other chimeric events identified from RNA-seq data.
## How to Use
1. **Input Dataset**: Select a dataset in `chira.sqlite` format. This should be generated using the [ChiRA tool](https://github.com/gglusman/ChiRA) from RNA sequencing data. 2. **Visualization**: Once the dataset is loaded, you can: - Navigate through detected chimeric junctions. - Inspect fusion evidence, read alignments, and relevant gene annotations. - Interact with graphical views to zoom, filter, and highlight key features.
## Features
- **Interactive Graphs**: Explore chimeric junctions in detail with responsive plots. - **Gene Annotations**: Visual cues help correlate fusion sites with gene models. - **Efficient Performance**: Supports large datasets with client-side rendering.
## Requirements
Ensure the input dataset has the `.chira.sqlite` extension and includes all necessary metadata from a successful ChiRA analysis run.
---
For more information on the ChiRA pipeline or to generate compatible files, visit the official repository: [https://github.com/gglusman/ChiRA](https://github.com/gglusman/ChiRA)
